subject: Law
title: Originalism vs. Living Constitution
description: A short lesson to help you apply Originalism vs. Living Constitution.

hook.text: Does the Constitution mean what it meant in 1787, or does its meaning evolve with society? Judges disagree sharply.

buildup.text: Originalists argue the text must be read as the framers understood it. Meaning was fixed at ratification.

discovery.text: Living constitutionalists say the document's broad principles must adapt to circumstances the framers never imagined.

twist.text: In practice, most judges blend both approaches. Pure originalism and pure living readings are rare in actual opinions.

climax.text: This debate shapes every major rulingâ€”from gun rights to privacy to same-sex marriage.

punchline.text: How you read the Constitution determines what it says.

quiz.question: What do originalists believe about constitutional interpretation?
